Title: What is your recommendation?
Kanji: アンナ: あ、この　本　いい　なあ、あれ　も　面白そう
アンナ: さくらさん　の　おすすめ　は　何　です　か
さくら: これ　は　どう
アンナ:　ホラー　は　ちょっと。。。
Kana: アンナ: あ、この　ほん　いい　なあ、あれ　も　おもしろそう
アンナ: さくらさん　の　おすすめ　は　なん　です　か
さくら: これ　は　どう
アンナ:　ホラー　は　ちょっと。。。
Romaji: Anna: A. Kono hon ii nā, are mo omoshirosō
Anna: Sakura-san no osusume wa nan desu ka
English: Anna: Ah! This book is good. That also looks interesting.
Anna: Sakura, What is your recommendation? (What's Sakura's recommendation?)
Anna: Horror stores are a little bit..
Vocabulary: - いい　なあ (ii nā) = It's good. => いい(ii) = Good. なあ (nā) Particle added when talking to yourself
- おもしろそう (omoshirosō) = To look interesting
- どう (dō) = Expresion. What do you think
- ちょっと (chotto) = A little bit. It uses to refuses an offer.
Description: おもしろそう (omoshirosō) = Too look/seem interesting
If you add そう(sō) after an adjective, you can talk about what you think or guess.
いい (II) Adjectives, replace I with そう(sō):
- おもしろい (Omoshiroi) = Interesting => おもしろそう (omoshirosō) = Seem to be interesting
- いそがしい (Isogashii) = Busy => いそがしそう (Isogashisō) = Seem to be busy
な (Na) Adjectives, add そう(sō) at the end:
- ひま(Hima) = Free => ひまそう (Himasō)　= Seem to be free
